newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: CYCLING-INJURED OLYMPIC CHAMPION RICHARD OUT FOR THREE WEEKS.
newsitem.headline: CYCLING-INJURED OLYMPIC CHAMPION RICHARD OUT FOR THREE WEEKS.

text.p: Olympic road race cycling champion Pascal Richard will be out of action for three weeks after doctors found on Monday that injuries sustained in an accident were more serious than first thought.
The Swiss was involved in a collision with a car while on a training ride on Sunday.
He was taken by ambulance to a hospital where he was treated for a broken left hand, two broken fingers in his right hand and a badly bruised left thigh.
The medical examination on Monday showed Richard had also suffered a cracked sternum.
